bibl.title: Two Unidentified Christian Fragments in the Michigan Collection.
bibl.note: Two unpublished parchment fragments, written in Coptic on both faces. Provenance unknown (Medinet-el-Fayoum?), the dating has been left open. Likely a late monastic manuscript: religious vocabulary; nomina sacra; list of the disciples in the same order as in the Gospel of Matthew. Perhaps a Christian commentary, homily, or some other type of theological work that cites Matthew's Gospel.
bibl.seg: Brice C. Jones, Two Unidentified Christian Fragments in the Michigan Collection.

Two unpublished parchment fragments, written in Coptic on both faces. Provenance unknown (Medinet-el-Fayoum?), the dating has been left open. Likely a late monastic manuscript: religious vocabulary; nomina sacra; list of the disciples in the same order as in the Gospel of Matthew. Perhaps a Christian commentary, homily, or some other type of theological work that cites Matthew's Gospel.
